verses.verse: Be not thou envious <WH7065> against evil <WH7451> men <WH582>; Neither desire to be with them <WH183>:
For their heart <WH3820> studieth <WH1897> oppression <WH7701>, And their lips <WH8193> talk <WH1696> of mischief <WH5999>.
Through wisdom <WH2451> is a house <WH1004> builded <WH1129>; And by understanding <WH8394> it is established <WH3559>;
And by knowledge <WH1847> are the chambers <WH2315> filled <WH4390> With all precious <WH3368> and pleasant <WH5273> riches <WH1952>.
A wise <WH2450> man <WH1397> is strong <WH5797>; Yea <WH376>, a man of knowledge <WH1847> increaseth <WH553> might <WH3581>.
For by wise guidance <WH8458> thou shalt make <WH6213> thy war <WH4421>; And in the multitude <WH7230> of counsellors <WH3289> there is safety <WH8668>.
Wisdom <WH2454> is too high <WH7311> for a fool <WH191>: He openeth <WH6605> not his mouth <WH6310> in the gate <WH8179>.
He that deviseth <WH2803> to do evil <WH7489>, Men shall call <WH7121> him a mischief <WH4209> - maker <WH1167>.
The thought <WH2154> of foolishness <WH200> is sin <WH2403>; And the scoffer <WH3887> is an abomination <WH8441> to men <WH120>.
If thou faint <WH7503> in the day <WH3117> of adversity <WH6869>, Thy strength <WH3581> is small <WH6862>.
Deliver <WH5337> them that are carried <WH3947> away unto death <WH4194>, And those that are ready <WH4131> to be slain <WH4194> see that thou hold back <WH2820>.

If thou sayest <WH559>, Behold <WH3045>, we knew not this <WH8505>; Doth not he that weigheth the hearts <WH3826> consider <WH995> it <WH5341>? And he that keepeth thy soul <WH5315>, doth not he know <WH3045> it <WH7725>? And shall not he render to every man <WH120> according to his work <WH6467>?
My son <WH1121>, eat <WH398> thou honey <WH1706>, for it is good <WH2896>; And the droppings of the honeycomb <WH5317>, which are sweet <WH4966> to thy taste <WH2441>:

So shalt thou know <WH3045> wisdom <WH2451> to be unto thy soul <WH5315>; If thou hast found <WH4672> it <WH3426>, then shall there be a reward <WH319>, And thy hope <WH8615> shall not be cut off <WH3772>.
Lay not wait <WH693>, O wicked <WH7563> man <WH5116>, against the habitation of the righteous <WH6662>; Destroy <WH7703> not his resting-place <WH7258>:
For a righteous <WH6662> man falleth <WH5307> seven times <WH7651>, and riseth up again <WH6965>; But the wicked <WH7563> are overthrown <WH3782> by calamity <WH7451>.
Rejoice <WH8055> not when thine enemy <WH341> falleth <WH5307>, And let not thy heart <WH3820> be glad <WH1523> when he is overthrown <WH3782>;
Lest Jehovah <WH3068> see <WH7200> it <WH7489>, and it displease him <WH7725>, And he turn away his wrath from him <WH639>.
Fret <WH2734> not thyself because of evil-doers <WH7489>; Neither be thou envious <WH7065> at the wicked <WH7563>:
For there shall be no reward <WH319> to the evil <WH7451> man <WH5216>; The lamp of the wicked <WH7563> shall be put out <WH1846>.
My son <WH1121>, fear <WH3372> thou Jehovah <WH3068> and the king <WH4428>; And company <WH6148> not with them that are given to change <WH8138>:
For their calamity <WH343> shall rise <WH6965> suddenly <WH6597>; And the destruction <WH6365> from them both <WH8147>, who knoweth it <WH3045>?
These also are sayings of the wise <WH2450>. To have respect <WH5234> of persons <WH6440> in judgment <WH4941> is not good <WH2896>.
He that saith <WH559> unto the wicked <WH7563>, Thou art righteous <WH6662>; Peoples <WH5971> shall curse <WH5344> him <WH5971>, nations shall abhor him <WH2194>:
But to them that rebuke <WH3198> him shall be delight <WH5276>, And a good <WH2896> blessing <WH1293> shall come upon them <WH935>.
He kisseth <WH5401> the lips <WH8193> Who giveth <WH7725> a right <WH5228> answer <WH1697>.
Prepare <WH3559> thy work <WH4399> without <WH2351>, And make it ready <WH6257> for thee in the field <WH7704>; And afterwards <WH310> build <WH1129> thy house <WH1004>.
Be not a witness <WH5707> against thy neighbor <WH7453> without cause <WH2600>; And deceive <WH6601> not with thy lips <WH8193>.
Say <WH559> not <WH6213>, I will do so to him as he hath done <WH6213> to me <WH7725>; I will render to the man <WH376> according to his work <WH6467>.
I went <WH5674> by the field <WH7704> of the sluggard <WH376>, And by the vineyard <WH3754> of the man <WH120> void <WH2638> of understanding <WH3820>;

And <WH5927>, lo, it was all grown over with thorns <WH7063>, The face <WH6440> thereof was covered <WH3680> with nettles <WH2738>, And the stone <WH68> wall <WH1444> thereof was broken down <WH2040>.
Then I beheld <WH2372>, and considered well <WH7896>; I saw <WH2372>, and received <WH3947> instruction <WH4148>:
Yet a little <WH4592> sleep <WH8142>, a little <WH4592> slumber <WH8572>, A little <WH4592> folding <WH2264> of the hands <WH3027> to sleep <WH7901>;
So shall thy poverty <WH7389> come <WH935> as a robber <WH1980>, And thy want <WH4270> as an armed <WH4043> man <WH376>.
